elevationruler.name: Elevation Ruler
elevationruler.keybindings.decrementElev: Decrease the elevation in grid increments when using the ruler.
elevationruler.keybindings.incrementElev: Increase the elevation in grid increments when using the ruler.
elevationruler.keybindings.addWaypoint.h: When using the canvas ruler, add a waypoint.
elevationruler.keybindings.removeWaypoin: When using the canvas ruler, remove a waypoint.
elevationruler.keybindings.addWaypointTo: When token ruler is enabled and you are dragging a token, add a waypoint.
elevationruler.keybindings.removeWaypoin: When token ruler is enabled and you are dragging a token, remove a waypoint.
elevationruler.keybindings.togglePathfin: If the pathfinding button is enabled, holding this key will temporarily disable pathfinding. If the pathfinding button is not enabled, holding this key will temporarily enable pathfinding.
elevationruler.keybindings.forceToGround: When measuring, press this key to get the distance to the ground. Press again to revert.
elevationruler.keybindings.teleport.name: Teleport along ruler
elevationruler.keybindings.teleport.hint: When measuring, hold this key when you release the dragged token or hit the spacebar to move the token to the ruler destination without animation.
elevationruler.settings.levels-use-floor: If Levels module is active, label the ruler with the current floor, if the Levels UI floors are named.
elevationruler.settings.levels-labels-ui: Only when Levels UI is active
elevationruler.settings.prefer-token-ele: Add a control to the token toolbar. When toggled on, the control will keep the ruler at the elevation of the measuring token. Otherwise, the ruler destination will assume the elevation of the grid space or the token encountered at the destination point of the ruler.
elevationruler.settings.enable-token-rul: Display the ruler when dragging tokens.
elevationruler.settings.hide-elevation-r: Hide the Elevation from the Label when using a Ruler.
elevationruler.settings.hide-gm-ruler.hi: Do not display the GM's token ruler for other non-GM users.
elevationruler.settings.speed-highlighti: When using the ruler, use different colors for token walk/dash/max distance.
When enabled, the user cannot see a hostile or secret token's speed unless the user has observer or owner permissions.
elevationruler.settings.token-ruler-comb: Display history in the ruler when a token moves repeatedly in the same combat round.
elevationruler.settings.combine-prior-wi: Combine Prior Movement with Total Movement
When Track Combat Move is enabled, combine the token's prior movement in the round with the total movement. Otherwise, place the prior movement on a separate line.
elevationruler.settings.token-speed-prop: For token speed highlighting, this is the actor property representing token walking speed.
elevationruler.settings.token-fly-proper: For token speed highlighting, this is the actor property representing token flying speed.
elevationruler.settings.token-burrow-pro: For token speed highlighting, this is the actor property representing token burrowing speed.
elevationruler.settings.token-speed-mult: For token speed highlighting, this is the multiplier used to go from walk to run (dash) to maximum. For example, with a multiplier of 2, a token with 25 walk speed will have its ruler highlight orange after the first 25 units of distance, and red after the first 50.
elevationruler.settings.round-to-multipl: Round the distance displayed to the nearest multiple of the number entered. Set to 0 to disable rounding.
elevationruler.settings.token-terrain-mu: Penalize movement through other tokens. Set to 1 for no penalty, less than one to grant a bonus, greater than 1 to impose a penalty multiplier. For example, set to 2 to double movement cost through a token.
If enabled, treats the token move penalty as a fixed amount of additional distance. For example, set to 5 to add +5 to each square of movement. Negative values provide a flat bonus.
elevationruler.settings.pathfinding_enab: When enabled, adds a pathfinding togglee to the Token controls that will cause the ruler to map a path around walls and tokens, depending on settings. Disable this if pathfinding is causing compatibility issues. Disabling may also result in a small performance increase.
elevationruler.settings.pathfinding_toke: For pathfinding, do tokens block the path?
elevationruler.settings.pathfinding_limi: When pathfinding, limit the range of the pathfinding to explored areas unless the user is the GM
elevationruler.settings.pathfinding_snap: When pathfinding on a gridded map, snap the path to grid centers unless doing so would result in the path getting blocked.
elevationruler.settings.grid-terrain-alg: When on a grid, how to account for movement penalties or bonuses from terrain and tokens? Center: apply if the terrain/token overlaps the grid center; Percent Area: apply if the terrain/token covers at least this much of the grid square/hex; Euclidean: prorate based on percent of line segment within the terrain/token between this grid square/hex and the previous.
elevationruler.settings.grid-terrain-are: If 'Percent Area' is selected for Terrain Grid Measurement, this determines the percent overlap required for the terrain/token to count when measuring on grids.
elevationruler.settings.automatic-moveme: Automatically detect the movement type based on token position. Set the token status effect to 'fly' or 'burrowing' to override.
elevationruler.settings.euclidean-grid-d: For gridded scenes, if 'Exact (âˆš2)' is chosen for the 'Square Grid Diagonals' core setting, this will force it to measure Euclidean distance instead of distance in unit hexes/squares. For hex grids, only diagonal elevation movement is affected.
elevationruler.settings.scale-text.name: Scale Ruler Text
elevationruler.settings.scale-text.hint: When enabled, ruler text will be scaled depending on `canvas.dimensions.size`. Further adjust scaling by using `CONFIG.elevationruler.labeling.textScale`.
elevationruler.settings.force-grid-penal: When enabled, move penalties only apply if the token/drawing/region covers the center of the hex/square and penalties are applied per-square or per-hex on gridded maps. When disabled, movement penalties are applied proportionally to the move. For example, if a drawing with a x2 move penalty covers 3/4 of a grid square, it will apply to 3/4 of the move through that square (i.e., 1.5x penalty).
elevationruler.settings.customized-label: Customize the ruler text. Change styles using `CONFIG.elevationruler.labeling.styles` and `CONFIG.elevationruler.labeling.icons`.
elevationruler.drawingconfig.movementPen: Set to 1 for no penalty, less than one to grant a bonus, greater than 1 to impose a penalty multiplier. For example, set to 2 to double movement cost through this area. Movement under the drawing elevation will be ignored.
elevationruler.drawingconfig.flatMovemen: If enabled, treats the penalty as a fixed amount of additional distance. For example, set to 5 to add +5 to each square of movement. Negative values provide a flat bonus.
Apply movement cost multipliers to tokens moving through this region. 1 = normal speed, 2 = half speed (difficult terrain), 0.5 = double speed.
Movement cost multiplier for walking. 2 = difficult terrain (half speed).
